meta.premise: Replace celestial metaphors with 8 diverse families: Neural Gardens (organic), Architectural Bridges (structural), Harmonic Resonance (musical), Woven Patterns (textile), Geological Strata (earth), Fluid Dynamics (liquid), Prismatic Light (optical), Circuit Patterns (electronic). Enforce novelty ≥0.8, clarity ≥0.95, zero repetition. Target: consciousness technology with 3-layer flow (Poetic → Academic → User-Friendly) and MATRIZ integration.

citations.title: From Whale-Roads to Modern Metaphors: Kennings in Contemporary Poetry
citations.author: Gilliam Writers Group
citations.key_insight: Kennings, metaphorical compounds rooted in Old English poetry, are adapted in contemporary poetry to evoke rich, layered imagery often drawing from natural and organic domains.

citations.title: 50 Contemporary Poets on the Best Poems they Read in 2024
citations.author: Various Contemporary Poets
citations.key_insight: Contemporary poetry frequently explores identity, selfhood, and class through metaphors grounded in physicality and social reality, avoiding celestial imagery.

citations.title: The Best Twenty-First-Century Poems Everyone Should Read
citations.author: Interesting Literature
citations.key_insight: Poems like Alice Oswald’s ‘Dunt’ use geological and liquid metaphors (a dried-up river) to explore themes of flow and poetic creation, exemplifying non-celestial metaphor trends.

citations.title: 10 Must-Read Modern Poets
citations.author: Encyclopedia Britannica
citations.key_insight: Poets like Ross Gay use organic and biological metaphors (gardening, rivers, animals) to convey compassion and joy, emphasizing earthly and bodily imagery over celestial.

citations.title: Types of Poetry to Try in 2025 - Free the Verse
citations.author: Free the Verse Editorial
citations.key_insight: Hybrid and genre-blurring poetry forms are rising, incorporating layered metaphors from diverse domains including organic and architectural, moving away from traditional celestial tropes.

metaphor_families.name: Neural Gardens
metaphor_families.description: Metaphors combining organic biology and technology to depict mental and emotional landscapes as cultivated, growing gardens or networks.
exemplar_quotes: Thoughts bloom like wildflowers in the neural garden
Memories root deep in the soil of the mind

metaphor_families.name: Architectural Echoes
metaphor_families.description: Using architectural structures and construction imagery to represent identity, memory, and social constructs.
exemplar_quotes: Walls of silence rise between us
The foundation of my past crumbles beneath

metaphor_families.name: Liquid Threads
metaphor_families.description: Metaphors that blend liquid and textile imagery to convey fluidity, connection, and transformation.
exemplar_quotes: Rivers weave through the fabric of time
Threads of water stitch the earth’s skin

metaphor_families.name: Quantum Patterns
metaphor_families.description: Metaphors inspired by quantum physics and patterns to explore uncertainty, interconnectedness, and complexity without relying on celestial imagery.
exemplar_quotes: Particles dance in the web of possibility
Entangled fates ripple through the void

metaphor_families.name: Geological Time
metaphor_families.description: Metaphors drawing on geological processes and formations to express endurance, change, and deep time.
exemplar_quotes: Mountains hold the weight of forgotten years
Fossils whisper secrets beneath the surface

metaphor_families.name: Musical Currents
metaphor_families.description: Musical metaphors that evoke rhythm, harmony, and dissonance to describe emotional states and social dynamics.
exemplar_quotes: Our voices rise in a discordant symphony
The heartbeat drums a steady cadence
